topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53a5f1486368721a58270300#post_53a5f1486368721a58270300
[bq="uc9"]"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53a5ed096368721c5a0f0100#post_53a5ed096368721c5a0f0100
[bq="Randomosaur"]"@Zennistrad":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53a5616163687246cc920000#post_53a5616163687246cc920000
I like ponies but I hate Pokemon. I am quite torn.[/bq]
I'm probably going to get a ton of shit for this, but I'm with you on this.  I don't like pokemon.

What I would like to see from a monster capture game is a combination of pokemon and digimon and add in a bit of real time battles to it.  What I mean by this is like how with digimon there's a couple basic baby digimon to which they then digivolve into a assortment of possible rookies to which then they have a wider assortment of champions and a even wider assortment of ultimates and megavolutions.  So only like one or two starters total to which they then evolve into say thirty possible tier two evolutions each then each of those can evolve into say three or so tier three evolutions each then two or so tier four evolutions.  It would make it so if you don't feel like going out and getting monsters by backtracking you can just raise the one you want.

Also real time environment battles.
Anime:
!http://i1.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/639/793/d61.gif!
Actual battles in the games:
!http://25.media.tumblr.com/17d44e2a3da264785a406c796cadfee0/tumblr_mgb1pabo5c1r3ifxzo1_500.gif!
That's just straight up false advertisement guys.  Admit it folks would totally jizz all over the walls if the pokemon games were actually like this clip of scyther vs onix.[/bq]
I'd also want a real time Pokemon Battle game. Maybe even warfare.

topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53a5f5e96368721a586d0500#post_53a5f5e96368721a586d0500
[bq="trashboat"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53a5f55a6368721b85f50400#post_53a5f55a6368721b85f50400
There's a difference between Western RPGS and JRPGS you know[/bq]
You do realize that the gaming industry has specific terminologies for specific types of gameplay right?  And that just cause a japanese company makes a game doesn't mean that there's a gaming police that goes around shooting anyone that emulates that right?  Like just cause pokemon originates from japan doesn't mean that if a american company makes a monster capture game that the police and swat team will come barging in shooting everyone on sight for "violating the difference between jprg and western rpg games".

What I mean by this is to use a analogy just cause fps games are popular in the usa doesn't mean japanese companies are forbidden to make fps games as well.

Also if I told you how much of AAA video game production gets outsourced to other countries chances are it would make some people cry that their favorite game wasn't 100% made in japan.  To further slap this argument almost all of the time during video game production does a large portion of a game get outsourced; just cause a game says "nintendo" or such on it doesn't mean that third party companies weren't involved to some degree.  It's actually really good that so much of video games' asset production are outsourced cause some times you run into problems that you can't solve and thus need a second opinion on or help on.  What I mean by this is that when a game says, "JRPG" what they actually mean is, "the game developer's main branch at which this game was developed was in japan and that a large portion of the game may have been developed outside of japan though".

Why does the video game industry function like this?  Cause it would be straight up near impossible to get anything done on time if none of the production was outsourced and delays would be the norm and be months on end.

What I said was that I stated would I would like for in a monster capture game and somehow you put the words "-uc9 wants to change pokemon to satisfy their tastes" in my mouth.  I was simply stating what I would like in a monster capture game.

RPG's that are mainly from japan are like pokemon, RPG's that are mainly from elsewhere are more varied

Can you guys fucking put away your Pokemon Hateboner's? God![/bq]
I'm starting to believe you don't know how video games are made.  I was saying that JRPG is a inaccurate term cause a lot of video game production is often outsourced to other countries and thus what JRPG means is the home company is based in japan.
